solution_line_template: Philip has {duck_percentage_increase} * {cows} = <<{duck_percentage_increase}*{cows}={additional_ducks}>>{additional_ducks} more ducks than cows.
So Philip's cows and ducks sum up to {cows} + {total_ducks} = <<{cows}+{total_ducks}={total_cows_and_ducks}>>{total_cows_and_ducks} animals.
If there are {total_cows_and_ducks} cows and ducks, that means Philip has {pig_fraction} * {total_cows_and_ducks} = <<{total_cows_and_ducks}*{pig_fraction}={total_pigs}>>{total_pigs} pigs.
In total Philip has {total_cows_and_ducks} + {total_pigs} = <<{total_cows_and_ducks}+{total_pigs}={total_animals}>>{total_animals} animals on his farm.
